body_html:
The location of the TensorFlow directory on Windows will depend on your Python distribution. You should be able to find it by doing the following:

C:\> python
>>>import tensorflow as tf
>>>print(tf.__file__ )

However, the TensorFlow directory doesn't currently include the tensorflow.models (see #5953), so even if you download the cifar10_train.py code it won't quite work. I've sent #6029 to fix this, and it should appear in the final release.

(I'll close this issue for now, but please watch #5953 for an update on when the tensorflow.models will be easily usable on Windows.)

C:\> python
>>>import tensorflow as tf
>>>print(tf.__file__ )

However, the TensorFlow directory doesn't currently include the tensorflow.models (see #5953), so even if you download the cifar10_train.py code it won't quite work. I've sent #6029 to fix this, and it should appear in the final release.
(I'll close this issue for now, but please watch #5953 for an update on when the tensorflow.models will be easily usable on Windows.)
body:
The location of the TensorFlow directory on Windows will depend on your Python distribution. You should be able to find it by doing the following:

```
C:\> python
>>>import tensorflow as tf
>>>print(tf.__file__ )
```

However, the TensorFlow directory doesn't currently include the `tensorflow.models` (see #5953), so even if you download the `cifar10_train.py` code it won't quite work. I've sent #6029 to fix this, and it should appear in the final release.

(I'll close this issue for now, but please watch #5953 for an update on when the `tensorflow.models` will be easily usable on Windows.)
